answers.answer: Have you taken the glucose test yet for diabetes?
I am taking that at my next visit on the 26th of October. Should I call and let the doctor know what I am feeling or will it be okay to wait?

I think it should be okay to wait but you may want to talk to a nurse at the office.Just keep drinking the fluids.  I was like that my entire pregnancy too.  I'm not sure where you live but I know I lived in the desert...AZ.  I drank like 2 gallons of water a day

How is your urine output? I don't think it would hurt to let the doctor know! I am not saying that is what it is but I know that that is a sign of diabetes! I hope I am wrong! Maybe your little bean is just thirsty :)

Well No I don't live in the desert, South Carolina. But my urine is the same as it has been. No changes that I have noticed any way. I will keep drinking water. Just kinda weird. I am a little worried to because I am going out of town next week for about 5 days and I don't like being away from home and the doctor just incase. Ya know? So I might just call and let them know what is going on. What do they do if you do test positive for diabetes?

I think you should definitely mention it to your Dr. next time you see her/him. Normally, you would not be scheduled for the glucose test until 24-28 weeks, but if you are under 25, you may not be asked to do that at all. (unless, they detect something in your urine) That is why I would mention it. I am very trusty myself (27weeks) but I have already taken my glucose test and am now waiting for the 3 hour test results. It is nothing to panic about, but let your dr. know.

I had the same conplaint the last time I had a reg visit, I'm 23 weeks now. My dr. did a reg. fasting blood sugar test just to be on the safe side and thankfully it was not elevated. I'm taking a blood pressure pill 4 times a day and we think it is making me thristy. I would mention it to your dr. it is nice to have peace of mind and make sure it isn't a glucose problem!

If you pass the 1 hour glucose test, there is nothing else to do. If it turns out over 140, you will be scheduled for the 3 hour test and if you fail that one then you will be put on diet to monitor that your baby does not get huge since all of your sugar intake is now going to her/him. There is a bit more to it, but unless you know, no need to worry about it.
PS: I drink anywhere from 70-100 OZ a day. Sometimes even more. That is how tursty I get! LOL
you could buy the glucose test strips you can get at the pharmacy to pee on...but DEFINITELY call your doctor. You don't want to mess around with blood sugars if that is the problem.
Okay I will let her know. I am under 25 I am only 23 but I am schedule to have that test done at my appt. on the 26th. Thanks alot for all your answers ladies! Have a great day!

I was quite thirsty about 23 weeks and did the glusose test at 28 weeks and was positive I had a fear idea it was the gd I was thirsty alot at night but now I know whats wrong all is good I have changed my diet and drink alot more water and blood sugars have been great I test my sugars 3x days and dont have the need for insulin. I have only had sugar in my urine once so the only way to know for sure if you have the diabetes is the 2 or 3 hour test I did 2 hour test in my country NZ you drink 75g of sugary drink get tested before and then 2 hours later but allowed no food from 8pm the night before water was fine. Oh you only do the longer one if the 1 hour one failed.  But you may just be thirsty with hot climate and being pregnant good luck.
Have you gotten your THYROID checked?  If not tell the Dr your symptoms it could be your thyroid from you being pg and your hormones flaring.

question: I am getting so dehydrated. I will drink glass after glass of water and still feel thirsty. I am 23 weeks pregnant and this just started like 2 days ago. Is this normal?
title: Thirsty all the time... 23 weeks
